intro: Trioptolemea glabra, commonly known as the smooth trioptolemea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Trioptolemea glabra is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access groundwater.
